isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: HOLSET SS 296 AND QE 296/338 - REMOVE

warning.para: When any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure to set the parking brake and block the vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.
Do not attempt to remove or disassemble components with air pressure in the system. Failure to drain system of air pressure before removing components may cause personal injury or death.

step1.para: Drain all air pressure from the air system.
Use steam to clean the compressor and use compressed air to dry ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Cleaning and Drying the Compressor

warning.para: Steam and compressed air present hazards that can result in burns, eye damage or other personal injury. Always wear protective clothing and eye wear.

step1.para: Disconnect all air, water and oil lines leading to and from the compressor. Label them for correct installation later and plug them to prevent contamination.
Remove the compressor from the engine.
Remove the drive gear retaining bolt and washer ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Drive Gear Retaining Bolt

note.para: Use a hammer handle or socket drive extension wedged between the crankshaft counterweight and crankcase to keep the crankshaft from turning.

step1.para: Use puller (ZTSE-4229) to remove the drive gear from the compressor crankshaft ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Puller to Remove Drive Gear

step1.para: Puller bolts must be M8 X 1.25-6H thread.
Inspect the gear and related parts for wear or damage. If any parts are found to be worn or damaged, they must be replaced.
